image.altText: A black and white close up of Donald Trump's face, encroached on both sides by the stars and stripes of the US flag.

props.synopsis: Trump's march to re-take the White House continues with renewed determination. If he wins he'll have an "army" of 10,000 recruits at his disposal to help implement his controversial agenda.

title.children: The 'army' being recruited for the next Trump presidency

image.altText: A graphic showing a Medicare card, $100 bills, COVID cells and scientific beakers

props.synopsis: Some Australian pathology companies engaged in widespread and "systematic rorting" at the height of the COVID-19 pandemic, with new documents revealing accusations of fraud, cost-shifting and "opportunistic" claiming.

title.children: Doctor claimed 21,000 COVID tests in a single day: How some pathology companies 'rorted' Medicare during the pandemic

image.altText: A map of a green field with three social media posts falling on it. The largest says "Looking more and more like an inside job"

props.synopsis: Falsehoods about former US president Donald Trump's attempted assassination are spreading online faster than journalists can assemble an accurate account of what we know. ABC News Verify has assembled the key claims, and how they have gained traction.

title.children: How politics, engagement bait and money opened up a firehose of falsehoods after Trump's shooting

image.altText: An older man wearing a red tie, white shirt and a black suit jacket with a serious expression

props.synopsis: A US judge dismisses the criminal case accusing Donald Trump of illegally holding onto classified documents, dealing the former president another major legal victory as the Republican seeks a return to the White House.

title.children: Judge tosses Trump documents case, ruling prosecutor unlawfully appointed

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiling as an excited voter, a young woman, takes a selfie with him.

props.synopsis: The attempted assassination of Donald Trump has Australian politicians calling for a calming of public debates, amid fears attacks on elected figures here could see a greater need for police protection.

title.children: Australian MP safety review after Donald Trump assassination attempt

image.altText: Bright red letters are erected to spell 'Trump'.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has refused to let an assassination attempt keep him from his party's major pre-election get-together, which will champion his vision for a changed America.

title.children: Just after surviving a shooting, Trump's the star at the Republican National Convention. Here's what to expect

image.altText: The black metal gate of a housing estate with the words "Lifestyle Wollert" on a wall.

props.synopsis: Lifestyle Communities share price plunges more than 18 per cent in the wake of an ABC investigation detailing claims the operator of gated communities for the over 50s is gouging residents with unfair fees including charging the dead rent.

title.children: Investors slash more than $200 million from value of land lease operator after ABC investigation

image.altText: A young woman in a staw hat next to a man in sunglasses

props.synopsis: I went to the Trump rally in Pennsylvania to see his campaign in action. I can viscerally recall the moment I realised there was a live possibility I could be shot at any second in an open field.

title.children: We came for the spectacle of a Trump rally. We left frazzled and shell-shocked

image.altText: One of the workers is seen with an orange hood and visor on, while the other is in a white protective suit

props.synopsis: Even without nuclear power and submarines in use, the nation is already producing, processing and storing radioactive waste.

title.children: Sealed away in steel and concrete is Australia's nuclear waste legacy

image.altText: Dylan Edwards is tackled by Val Holmes

props.synopsis: We're in for a blockbuster State of Origin decider in Brisbane this week. Here's what you need to know if you plan on catching the action.

title.children: Ready for the State of Origin decider? Here's what you need to know ahead of kick-off

image.altText: A face portrait of Clare O'Neil speaking and looking serious, hair down

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Clare O'Neil has warned that democracy in Australia and overseas is under threat due to populism, misinformation and foreign interference.

title.children: Democracy is 'backsliding' and needs to adapt, Clare O'Neil warns

image.altText: Jay Slater smiles as he poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Spanish rescue teams in Tenerife find human remains in the area where British teenager Jay Slater went missing nearly a month ago, local police say.

title.children: Spanish rescuers find remains thought to be of missing British teenager Jay Slater

image.altText: Thomas Cooks

props.synopsis: The motives, opinions, affiliations and potential allies of the 20-year-old gunman responsible for the attempted assassination attempt of Donald Trump remain unknown, authorities say.

title.children: Trump rally shooter's motives remain unknown as investigators find explosive materials in car

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and with grey hair stands outside a football stadium.

props.synopsis: Legendary Australian commentator Bruce McAvaney OAM will headline the ABC's radio coverage of the 2024 Paris Olympic Games later this month.

title.children: Veteran sports commentator Bruce McAvaney picks up mic for Paris Olympics

image.altText: Novak Djokovic sits shirtless with his head down on a chair at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Novak Djokovic has the history he has long craved, but in the months since he won a record 24th grand slam singles title, the sport and Carlos Alcaraz have passed him by.

title.children: Slumped, broken and beaten: The age of Djokovic is ending

image.altText: An older woman with a blonde bob, black blazer and blue shirt holding a red book.

props.synopsis: Publishers, authors and readers have growing concerns pre-orders made through Booktopia won't make it into customers' hands.

title.children: Booktopia in $60 million debt as administrators investigate whether collapsed retailer traded while insolvent

image.altText: Jacinta Allan stands at a lectern with microphones in front of her. Behind her is the Australian flag

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has labelled alleged behaviour by the state's construction union as "thuggish and appalling".

title.children: Premier asks Labor to suspend CFMEU from Victorian party amid allegations of 'thuggish' behaviour

image.altText: a woman with short dark hair wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: Fourteen people, including her parents Kerrie and Jason Struhs, are on trial in the Supreme Court in Brisbane, charged over the death of Elizabeth Struhs.

title.children: Elizabeth Struhs's sister gives evidence against estranged family charged over eight-year-old's death

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie and shades

props.synopsis: Andrew David, Maurice Hawell and Marius Hawell were all found guilty of five counts of aggravated sexual assault, one count of aggravated sexual touching and one count of attempted aggravated sexual assault.

title.children: Three men found guilty over a gang rape of teenage women during bucks party weekend

image.altText: Man walking into court holding documents and covering his face with an umbrella.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Supreme Court judge Gregory Geason would allegedly become "venomous" after drinking alcohol, subjecting a woman to regular verbal abuse and tracking her with her phone. She has given evidence to a court, detailing the alleged abuse she experienced.

title.children: He could 'suddenly flip': Judge allegedly assaulted woman, tracked her through an app

image.altText: three wild horses stand under trees speckled with snow at barrington tops in nsw's hunter valley

props.synopsis: After an unprecedented year without snow in 2023, elevated parts of NSW are finally turning white.

title.children: Snowy night ahead for NSW with first flakes in years to settle along the ranges

image.altText: An orange coloured supply ship vessel docked at a port

props.synopsis: For the first time since 2010, the company owning the official salvage rights to Titanic launches a 20-day voyage to the shipwreck. It follows last year's ill-fated Titan submersible journey which intended to be a tourist offering.

title.children: First expedition to Titanic wreckage launched in 14 years with hopes for 'monumental undertaking'

image.altText: A West Coast AFL player lies on the ground after being tackled as a Brisbane forward lies on top of him.

props.synopsis: Three players, including Brisbane star Charlie Cameron, receive three-match bans on a big day at the AFL Match Review.

title.children: Lions' Charlie Cameron leads trio of players to receive three-match bans

image.altText: A packet of flower seeds held in a hand outside a Bunnings hardware store.

props.synopsis: Major Australian nurseries, including retail giant Bunnings, are selling plants listed by governments and their own industry body as invasive weeds.

title.children: Bunnings under fire for selling plants that become 'a ticking time bomb'

image.altText: Phoebe, Prue and Piper Halliwell sisters smize in a promo image for the Charmed TV series, cut out against a blue backdrop.

props.synopsis: Here's what you might have missed in entertainment news over the weekend, from the many tributes to Shannen Doherty, to Harry Styles taking to the stage with Stevie Nicks.

title.children: The late Shannen Doherty was a 'soft-hearted badass' and a 'force of nature', say fellow actors

image.altText: A man stands with a younger girl as both smile and hold a balloon shaped like 20

props.synopsis: Corey Comperatore, 50, is dead and two other men are in critical condition following the attempted assassination of Donald Trump.

title.children: Volunteer firefighter killed at Trump rally died shielding wife and daughter from gunfire

image.altText: two people in personal protection suits examine a a dead animal on a beach

props.synopsis: Disease authorities say there is potential for the arrival of a bird flu strain that has already been detected in Asia and Antarctica.

title.children: Bird flu strain behind global animal pandemic closes in on Australian shores

image.altText: A mid-shot of 82-year-old former Catholic priest Raymond Hevern walking outside court in Perth wearing a beige jacket.

props.synopsis: A former Catholic priest accused of sexually abusing a nine year-old girl at a WA mission in the 1980s is granted bail.

title.children: Ex-Catholic priest charged with more than a dozen historic child sexual abuse charges

image.altText: Smoke clouds rise into the night sky.

props.synopsis: While the investigation into last month's incident is ongoing, miners are telling of how a flame disappearing into the dark was the signal for them to run.

title.children: Like a scene from Game of Thrones: How the Grosvenor coal mine fire unfolded

image.altText: Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump is surround by US Secret Service agents at a campaign rally.

props.synopsis: The attempted assassination of former US president Donald Trump has sent a chill through the Western democratic world — and reminded us all just how dangerous and febrile political polarisation can be.

title.children: The unfounded theories and misinformation after the Trump shooting will be where the danger lies

image.altText: A T-shirt being sold in the US shows a photo of former president Donald Trump raising his fist after being shot

props.synopsis: The image of former US president Donald Trump defiantly raising his fist after being shot became instantly historic. And it is appearing everywhere from mugs to dog cardigans.

title.children: Iconic image of 'bulletproof' Trump inspires MAGA merchandise

image.altText: Princess Catherine smiles courtside at Wimbledon in a purple dress

props.synopsis: Wimbledon is known for being one of the most prestigious tennis tournaments in the world — and for pulling a star-studded crowd. Here's who was spotted sitting courtside.

title.children: From Princess Catherine to Margot Robbie, see the famous faces who flocked to Wimbledon
